intro: Bartlettina chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí barberry, is a shrub native to Central America, particularly found in Panama and Costa Rica. It belongs to the Berberidaceae family and is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
